    • Method Detail

      • setProxy

        public static void setProxy(java.lang.String host,
                            int port)
        Set the global HTTP proxy for all new HttpURLConnections and HttpsURLConnections that are created after this is called.

        useTor() will override this setting. Traffic must be directed to Tor using the proxy settings, and Orbot has its own proxy settings for connections that need proxies to work. So if "use Tor" is enabled, as tested by looking for the static instance of Proxy, then no other proxy settings are allowed to override the current Tor proxy.

        Parameters:
        host - the IP address for the HTTP proxy to use globally
        port - the port number for the HTTP proxy to use globally
        See Also:
        setProxy(Proxy), clearProxy()

      • setProxy

        public static void setProxy(java.net.Proxy proxy)
        Set the global HTTP proxy for all new HttpURLConnections and HttpsURLConnections that are created after this is called.

        useTor() will override this setting. Traffic must be directed to Tor using the proxy settings, and Orbot has its own proxy settings for connections that need proxies to work. So if "use Tor" is enabled, as tested by looking for the static instance of Proxy, then no other proxy settings are allowed to override the current Tor proxy.

        Parameters:
        proxy - the HTTP proxy to use globally
        See Also:
        setProxy(String, int), clearProxy()

      • getProxy

        public static java.net.Proxy getProxy()
        Get the currently active global HTTP Proxy.
        Returns:
        the active HTTP Proxy

      • clearProxy

        public static void clearProxy()
        Clear the global HTTP proxy for all new HttpURLConnections and HttpsURLConnections that are created after this is called. This returns things to the default, proxy-less state.

      • useTor

        public static void useTor()
        Set Orbot as the global HTTP proxy for all new HttpURLConnection s and HttpsURLConnections that are created after this is called. This overrides all future calls to setProxy(Proxy), except to clear the proxy, e.g. #setProxy(null) or clearProxy().

        Traffic must be directed to Tor using the proxy settings, and Orbot has its own proxy settings for connections that need proxies to work. So if "use Tor" is enabled, as tested by looking for the static instance of Proxy, then no other proxy settings are allowed to override the current Tor proxy.

        See Also:
        clearProxy(), useGlobalProxy()

      • isURLConnectionUsingTor

        public static boolean isURLConnectionUsingTor()
        Makes a connection to check.torproject.org to read its results of whether the connection came via Tor or not.
        Returns:
        true if check.torproject.org says connection is via Tor, false if not or on error
        See Also:
        check.torproject.org

      • isNetCipherGetHttpURLConnectionUsingTor

        public static boolean isNetCipherGetHttpURLConnectionUsingTor()

      • useGlobalProxy

        public static void useGlobalProxy()
        Call this method in Application.onCreate() to enable NetCipher to control the proxying. This only works on Android 8.0 Oreo or newer. There needs to be a separate call to setProxy(Proxy) or useTor() for proxying to actually be enabled. clearProxy() will then remove the proxying when the global proxy control is in place, but the URLStreamHandlerFactory will stay in place until app restart.
        See Also:
        useTor(), setProxy(Proxy), setProxy(String, int), clearProxy(), URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory(URLStreamHandlerFactory)

      • useGlobalProxyWithDNSLeaksOnAndroid7x

        @Deprecated
public static void useGlobalProxyWithDNSLeaksOnAndroid7x()
        Deprecated. 
        This is the same as useGlobalProxy() except that it can run on Android 7.x (SDK 24 and 25). The global proxying leaks DNS on Android 7.x, so this is not suitable for a privacy proxy. It will make access proxying work. It can also be used as a failsafe to help prevent leaks when the proxying is configured per-connection.
        See Also:
        useGlobalProxy(), useTor(), setProxy(Proxy), setProxy(String, int), clearProxy(), URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory(URLStreamHandlerFactory)

      • getTlsOnlySocketFactory

        public static TlsOnlySocketFactory getTlsOnlySocketFactory()
        Get a TlsOnlySocketFactory from NetCipher.
        See Also:
        HttpsURLConnection.setDefaultSSLSocketFactory(SSLSocketFactory)

      • getTlsOnlySocketFactory

        public static TlsOnlySocketFactory getTlsOnlySocketFactory(boolean compatible)
        Get a TlsOnlySocketFactory from NetCipher, and specify whether it should use a more compatible, but less strong, suite of ciphers.
        See Also:
        HttpsURLConnection.setDefaultSSLSocketFactory(SSLSocketFactory)

      • getHttpURLConnection

        public static java.net.HttpURLConnection getHttpURLConnection(java.net.URL url,
                                                              boolean compatible)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Get a HttpURLConnection from a URL, and specify whether it should use a more compatible, but less strong, suite of ciphers.

        If useGlobalProxy() is called, this method will use the global proxy settings. For .onion addresses, this will still directly configure the proxy, but that should be the same exact settings.

        Parameters:
        url -
        compatible -
        Returns:
        the url in an instance of HttpURLConnection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the proxy or TLS setup is incorrect

      • getHttpsURLConnection

        public static javax.net.ssl.HttpsURLConnection getHttpsURLConnection(java.lang.String urlString)
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Get a HttpsURLConnection from a URL String using the best TLS configuration available on the device.
        Parameters:
        urlString -
        Returns:
        the URL in an instance of HttpsURLConnection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the proxy or TLS setup is incorrect, or if an HTTP URL is given that does not support HTTPS

      • getHttpURLConnection

        public static java.net.HttpURLConnection getHttpURLConnection(java.lang.String urlString)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Get a HttpURLConnection from a URL String. If it is an https:// link, then this will use the best TLS configuration available on the device.
        Parameters:
